intro: Notoseris triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered notoseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Notoseris triflora is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and dry conditions.
